Heartfelt sentiments expressed by the de: “The ascetic Gotama is such an elephant, sir! And as an elephant, he endures painful physical feelings that have come up—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, and disagreeable—unperturbed, with mindfulness and situational awareness.”
“The ascetic Gotama is such a lion, sir! And as a lion, he endures painful physical feelings … unperturbed.”
“The ascetic Gotama is such a thoroughbred, sir! And as a thoroughbred, he endures painful physical feelings … unperturbed.”
“The ascetic Gotama is such a chief bull, sir! And as a chief bull, he endures painful physical feelings … unperturbed.”
“The ascetic Gotama is such a behemoth, sir! And as a behemoth, he endures painful physical feelings … unperturbed.”
“The ascetic Gotama is truly tamed, sir! And as someone tamed, he endures painful physical feelings … unperturbed.”
Brahmins who practice mortification [sn1: Learned in the five Vedas, brahmins practice mortification for a full century.
But their minds are not properly freed, for those of base character don’t cross to the far shore.
Seized by craving, attached to precepts and observances, they practice rough mortification for a hundred years.
But their minds are not properly freed, for those of base character don’t cross to the far shore.
Qualities required to pass beyond Death’: Living diligent alone in the wilderness
